Subjective: Red, irritated right eye; feels like hair or speck of dust; started Tuesday morning; no pain, except when squeezing eyes shut; no impact on vision; no fever, cough, or shortness of breath; no recent travel or exposure to chemicals; no smoking/alcohol; works, takes care of daughter Isa; boyfriend away on holiday; Request: Wants to know if it's an eye infection and needs antibiotics.
Objective: Vitals: not recorded; Physical Exam: right eye red, thicker than left; red veins visible; no discharge or pus; left eye: some redness; pupils react normally to light.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis; no signs of bacterial infection or other conditions.
Plan: • Explanation: viral conjunctivitis, self-limiting; • Meds: artificial tears for soothing; • Lifestyle advice: avoid rubbing eye, use lukewarm water for comfort; • Safety netting: return if symptoms worsen, pain, pus, or vision changes within 2 weeks; • Follow-up: 2 weeks if symptoms persist.
